intro: Klasea khorasanica, commonly known as the Persian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Klasea khorasanica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
